content:
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION
Palais des Nations GENEVA - SWITZERLAND Telegr. : UNISANTE - Geneva
In reply please refer to :
C. L. 28. 1956
Prière de rappeler la référence :
Tel. : 33 10 00 - 33 20 00 - 33 40 00
¥818
ORGANISATION MONDIALE DE LA SANTÉ
Palais des Nations GENÈVE - SUISSE
Télégr. : UNISANTÉ - Genève
W.H.O
7 November 1956
4/56/12
回復
Sir,
I have the honour to refer to steps recently taken towards defining more clearly than hitherto, and towards co-ordinating the functions and activities of the International Centres for studies on enteric bacteria, with special reference to their relationships with national laboratories concerned with work of a similar nature.
The International Centres in question are (a) the International Salmonella and Escherichia Centre, Copenhagen, Denmark, (b) the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, USA, and (c) the International Shigella Centre, London, England. These Centres, by arrangement with the World Health Organization, are in a position to assist Member States of WHO in the matter of laboratory investigations on salmonella, escherichia and shigella micro-organisms, among which are potent causative agents of typhoid and para- typhoid fevers, food poisoning, infantile diarrhoea and dysentery.
In order to assist me in examining and defining precisely the functions which the International Centres can fulfil, and the exact way in which the laboratories of Member States may benefit by their activities, I invited the directors of the Centres, together with an expert nominated for the purpose by the International Association of Micro- biological Societies, to meet as a Consultant Group on 19 to 24 September 1955. This was mentioned in my Annual Report for 1955 (Off. Rec. Wld Hlth Org. 67, pp. xi and 45), and a detailed account of the position studied by the Group, and of their recommendations, ... is appended herewith as an Annex to this letter. The Annex can be regarded as:
The Director Department of Health Administration Ministry of Interior Taipeh
Taiwan Republic of China
cc: Dr J. Heng Liu, Director, China Office ABMAC, Taipeh Dr C. H. Yen, Department of Health, Taipeh Dr C. T. Loo, Deputy Director-General, Taipeh
ENCL: Detailed account
國史饭 Academia Historica
70

衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
I have the honour to refer to steps recently taken towards defining more clearly than
hitherto, and towards co-ordinating the functions and activities of the International Centres
for studies on enteric bacteria, with special reference to their relationships with national
laboratories concerned with work of a similar nature.
The International Centres in question are (a) the International Salmonella and
Escherichia Centre, Copenhagen, Denmark, (b) the International Shigella Centre,
Atlanta, USA, and (c) the International Shigella Centre, London, England. These Centres,
by arrangement with the World Health Organization, are in a position to assist Member
States of WHO in the matter of laboratory investigations on salmonella, escherichia and
shigella micro-organisms, among which are potent causative agents of typhoid and para-
typhoid fevers, food poisoning, infantile diarrhoea and dysentery.
In order to assist me in examining and defining precisely the functions which the
International Centres can fulfil, and the exact way in which the laboratories of Member
States may benefit by their activities, I invited the directors of the Centres, together
with an expert nominated for the purpose by the International Association of Micro-
biological Societies, to meet as a Consultant Group on 19 to 24 September 1955. This
was mentioned in my Annual Report for 1955 (Off. Rec. Wld Hlth Org. 67, pp. xi and 45),
and a detailed account of the position studied by the Group, and of their recommendations,
... is appended herewith as an Annex to this letter. The Annex can be regarded as:
cc: Dr J. Heng Liu, Director, China Office ABMAC, Taipeh
Dr C. H. Yen, Department of Health, Taipeh
Dr C. T. Loo, Deputy Director-General, Taipeh

paragraphs.content: 衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
Palais des Nations GENEVA - SWITZERLAND Telegr. : UNISANTE - Geneva

I have the honour to refer to steps recently taken towards defining more clearly than hitherto, and towards co-ordinating the functions and activities of the International Centres for studies on enteric bacteria, with special reference to their relationships with national laboratories concerned with work of a similar nature.

The International Centres in question are (a) the International Salmonella and Escherichia Centre, Copenhagen, Denmark, (b) the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, USA, and (c) the International Shigella Centre, London, England. These Centres, by arrangement with the World Health Organization, are in a position to assist Member States of WHO in the matter of laboratory investigations on salmonella, escherichia and shigella micro-organisms, among which are potent causative agents of typhoid and para- typhoid fevers, food poisoning, infantile diarrhoea and dysentery.

In order to assist me in examining and defining precisely the functions which the International Centres can fulfil, and the exact way in which the laboratories of Member States may benefit by their activities, I invited the directors of the Centres, together with an expert nominated for the purpose by the International Association of Micro- biological Societies, to meet as a Consultant Group on 19 to 24 September 1955. This was mentioned in my Annual Report for 1955 (Off. Rec. Wld Hlth Org. 67, pp. xi and 45), and a detailed account of the position studied by the Group, and of their recommendations, ... is appended herewith as an Annex to this letter. The Annex can be regarded as:
The Director Department of Health Administration Ministry of Interior Taipeh
